intro: Galium micranthum, commonly known as small-flower bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Galium micranthum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
